ProgramElementMissionDescription.val:
This project is the only R&D program for mine systems, and is the sole support for the capability to maintain the effectiveness of mines facing new threat targets and increasing emphasis on major regional conflicts and littoral warfare in shallow water. Project tasks are grouped into several areas: (1) Threat Modeling/Analysis, which collects, analyzes, and develops digital models of data on current priority threat target characteristics to support computer simulations; (2) Target Detection and Response, which uses target models to develop optimal mine designs, settings, and firing algorithms; and (3) Developing and upgrading Tactical Decision Aids (TDAs) to assist the warfighter in planning and placing more effective minefields.

Data Recorders: Mine data recorders record mine target detection and mine fire data during in-water reliability testing.  Current recorders are no longer supportable and cannot be used with the Quickstrike Mod 3.  New recorders will work with the programmable Target Detecting Device MK 71 used in the Mod 3. They will support in-water testing of all in-service Quickstrike Mods (0, 1, and 3).

SummaryExplanation.val: Total Adjustments: FY14 -$0.030 for Program/Misc. Adjustments.

ProjectMissionDescription.val:
This project is the only R&D program for mine systems, and is the sole support for the capability to maintain the effectiveness of mines facing new threat targets and increasing emphasis on major regional conflicts and littoral warfare in shallow water. Project tasks are grouped into several areas: (1) Threat Modeling/Analysis, which collects, analyzes, and develops digital models of data on current priority threat target characteristics to support computer simulations; (2) Target Detection and Response, which uses target models to develop optimal mine designs, settings, and firing algorithms; and (3) Developing and upgrading Tactical Decision Aids (TDAs) to assist the warfighter in planning and placing more effective minefields.

Data Recorders: Mine data recorders record mine target detection and mine fire data during in-water reliability testing. Current recorders are no longer supportable and cannot be used with the Quickstrike Mod 3. New recorders will work with the programmable Target Detecting Device MK 71 used in the Mod 3. They will support in-water testing of all in-service Quickstrike Mods (0, 1, and 3).

Text.val: Software Development: Modified algorithms based on testing results.  Began generating operational data (OPDATA) for the Fast Patrol Boat, Air Cushioned Vehicle, and large ship algorithms. Continued to work action items assigned by Navy and Air Force fuse safety boards.  Continued modifications to mine data recorder design.  Worked with P-8 Aircraft mission planning software designers to include transfer of MEDAL data to their system.

Software Development:  Modify algorithms based on testing results.  Continue generating OPDATA for fast patrol boat, air cushioned vehicle, and large ship algorithms.  Continue to work action items assigned by Navy and Air Force fuse safety boards.  Complete modification to mine data recorder design.  Continue to work with P-8 Aircraft mission planning software designers to include transfer of MEDAL data to their system.  Perform trade study for mine standoff delivery (Wing Kit Development) capability and develop modification to existing system.
Modify algorithms based on testing results. Continue generating OPDATA  for the Fast Patrol Boat, Air cushioned Vehicle, and large ship algorythms.
Conducted second in-water test of developed algorithms and begin analysis.  Continued Aircraft certification.

Conduct one in-water test to determine baseline reliability of the Quickstrike MK 65 Mod 3 system.  Continue Aircraft certification (to include F/A-18 and B-52). Perform test and evaluation on the MINES standoff (Wing Kit) capabiltiy.
Continue Aircraft certification (to include F/A-18 and B-52).

AcquisitionStrategy.val: Procurement of Target Detecting Device (TDD) Mk 71 and associated components.

PerformanceMetrics.val: Successfully develop new mine data recorders to work with the programmable TDD MK 71 used in the Mod 3.
